code: @Manual{,   title = {phylospatial: Tools for spatial phylogenetic analysis},   author = {Matthew Kling},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://matthewkling.github.io/phylospatial/}, }

title: Tools for spatial phylogenetic analysis
text: phylospatial R package spatial phylogentic analysis. field spatial phylogenetics focuses accounting evolutionary relationships among taxa describing biodiversity patterns, approach number advantages species-based accounting. library includes functions computing: diversity measures like phylogenetic diversity statistical hypothesis testing using randomization-based null models turnover measures like phylogenetic betaendemism phylogenetic regionalization phylogenetic conservation prioritization One feature differentiates phylospatial similar packages addition working binary presence/absence data, functions also work continuous quantities occurrence probabilities abundances. quantities treated weights throughout analyses package, avoiding need discard information thresholding data.

title: Tools for spatial phylogenetic analysis
text: package yet CRAN. can install development version phylospatial like :

title: Tools for spatial phylogenetic analysis
text: Spatial phylogenetic analyses require two essential ingredients: data geographic distributions set organisms, phylogeny representing evolutionary relationships. workflows phylospatial package involve creating data set class 'phylospatial' containing necessary components. user normally define object data using phylospatial() function, can also simulate demonstration dataset using ps_simulate(). get started, let’s load phylospatial library simulate demo data set. get peek underlying data, let’s plot geographic ranges terminal species:
code: library(phylospatial) library(tmap); library(magrittr) set.seed(123) ps <- ps_simulate(n_tips = 20, n_x = 50, n_y = 50, data_type = "probability") ps %>%       ps_get_ranges(tips_only = TRUE) %>%       tm_shape() +        tm_raster(palette = "inferno", style = "cont", title = "occurrence\nprobability")

title: Tools for spatial phylogenetic analysis
text: can pass phylospatial object various functions library. ps_diversity() function calculates number alpha diversity measures, including phylogenetic diversity (PD) phylogenetic endemism (PE), among others. Let’s calculate diversity metrics make plot PD:  can also use randomization calculate statistical significance diversity metrics null model, using ps_rand() function. default null model uses stratified randomization designed use continuous occurrence data. Let’s run 100 randomizations plot results PE. quantile value gives proportion randomizations observed PE greater randomized PE given grid cell (wanted identify “statistically significant” grid cells one-tailed test alpha = 0.05, cells values greater 0.95).

title: Tools for spatial phylogenetic analysis
text: can also look patterns phylogenetic similarity among locations. first step compute community phylogenetic distance every pair sites, using ps_dissim() function add pairwise distance matrix additional component spatial phylogenetic data set. function includes range scaling options alternative dissimilarity indices; let’s run example using quantitative Sorensen’s index (method = "bray"), weighting taxa inverse range size (endemism = TRUE), normalizing community sums emphasize relative compositional differences (normalize = TRUE): done , can assess spatial turnover patterns couple ways. can qualitatively visualize compositional differences converting distance matrix set colors representing similar two sites , using ps_rgb() function. Various ordination methods available; ’ll use "cmds":  can also perform formal cluster analysis splits landscape set evolutionary bioregions, using ps_regions() function. Let’s ask eight regions using "kmeans" clustering method:
code: ps <- ps_add_dissim(ps, method = "bray", endemism = TRUE, normalize = TRUE) ps %>%       ps_rgb(method = "cmds") %>%       tm_shape() +       tm_rgb(max.value = 1) +       tm_layout(title = "Phylogenetic community ordination") ps %>%       ps_regions(k = 8, method = "kmeans") %>%       tm_shape() +       tm_raster(style = "cat", palette = "Dark2",                 title = "phylogenetic region") +       tm_layout(legend.outside = T)

title: Tools for spatial phylogenetic analysis
text: Finally, package can perform basic spatial conservation prioritization, identifying priority locations creation new protected areas order maximize biodiversity protection. done using ps_prioritize() function, uses greedy forward stepwise algorithm produce nested ranking conservation priorities. addition required spatial phylogenetic dataset, option supply raster layer indicating locations effectiveness existing protected areas. also modify parameters specify effective level protection provided new reserves, well shape “benefit” function determines relative importance protecting initial populations every taxon versus populations phylogenetically distinct taxa. example let’s stick defaults. map , highest-priority sites shown yellow.

what: phylospatial: Tools for spatial phylogenetic analysis — phylospatial-package
title: phylospatial: Tools for spatial phylogenetic analysis — phylospatial-package
text: package computes variety spatial phylogenetic metrics, using data phylogenetic tree geographic distributions terminal taxa. Functionality includes diversity endemism metrics, turnover biotic regionalization analyses, null model randomizations, spatial conservation prioritization. functions support quantitative community data addition binary data.

title: phylospatial: Tools for spatial phylogenetic analysis — phylospatial-package
text: Maintainer: Matthew Kling mkling@uvm.edu (ORCID)

what: Create a spatial phylogeny object — phylospatial
title: Create a spatial phylogeny object — phylospatial
text: function creates phylospatial object. core data type phylospatial library, required input functions package. two essential components spatial phylogeny object phylogenetic tree community data set.

title: Create a spatial phylogeny object — phylospatial
code: phylospatial(   tree,   comm,   spatial = NULL,   data_type = c("auto", "probability", "binary", "abundance"),   clade_fun = NULL,   check = TRUE )

title: Create a spatial phylogeny object — phylospatial
text: tree Phylogeny class phylo. Terminals whose names match comm dropped warning. comm Community data representing distribution terminal taxa across sites. Can matrix column per terminal row per site, SpatRaster one layer per terminal, sf data column per terminal. Taxa whose names match column/layer names comm tip labels tree dropped warning. spatial optional SpatRaster layer sf object indicating site locations. number cells rows must match comm. Ignored comm SpatRaster sf object. data_type Character giving data type comm. Must "binary", "probability", "abundance", "auto" (default). determines community values clades calculated values terminal taxa. "binary" (presence-absence), clade considered present site terminal clade present. "probability," clade probabilities calculated probability least one terminal present site. "abundance," clade abundances calculated sum abundances terminals clade site. "auto," attempt made guess three data types provided. Ignored comm already includes clade ranges. clade_fun Function calculate local community weight clade based community weights tips found given location. Must either NULL (default, case default function selected data_type used) summary function takes numeric vector returns single numeric output. Ignored comm already includes clade ranges. check Logical indicating whether community data validated. Default TRUE.

title: Create a spatial phylogeny object — phylospatial
text: "phylospatial" object, list containing following elements: "data_type"Character indicating community data type "treePhylogeny class phylo "comm"Community matrix community data "spatial"SpatRaster sf providing spatial coordinates rows comm. May missing spatial data supplied. "dissim"community dissimilary matrix class dist indicating pairwise phylogenetic dissimilarity sites. Missing unless ps_dissim(..., add = T) called.

title: Plot alternative lambda values — plot_lambda
text: Show plot illustrating alternative values lambda parameter ps_prioritize. Lambda determines shape "benefit" function determines conservation value protecting given proportion geographic range species clade. Positive values place higher priority protecting additional populations largely unprotected taxa, whereas negative values place higher priority protecting additional populations relatively well-protected taxa. default value used ps_prioritize 1.

title: Plot alternative lambda values — plot_lambda

what: Add community dissimilarity data to a phylospatial object — ps_add_dissim
title: Add community dissimilarity data to a phylospatial object — ps_add_dissim
text: function calculates pairwise quantitative phylogenetic dissimilarity communities returns phylospatial object dissimilarity data element called dissim.

title: Add community dissimilarity data to a phylospatial object — ps_add_dissim
code: ps_add_dissim(ps, method = "bray", endemism = FALSE, normalize = TRUE, ...)

title: Add community dissimilarity data to a phylospatial object — ps_add_dissim
text: ps phylospatial object. method Character indicating dissimilarity index use, passed vegdist. default "bray", .e. Bray-Curtis distance, also known quantitative Sorensen's. See vegdist complete list options. endemism Logical indicating whether community values divided column totals (taxon range sizes) derive endemism. normalize Logical indicating whether community values divided row totals (community sums). TRUE, dissimilarity based proportional community composition. happens endemism derived. ... Additional arguments passed vegdist.

title: Add community dissimilarity data to a phylospatial object — ps_add_dissim
text: ps new dissim element added.

title: Binary randomization tests including CANAPE — ps_canape
text: function runs canaper::cpr_rand_test; see help function details. also runs canaper::cpr_classify_endem result, includes resulting classification additional variable, 'endem_type', output. 'endem_type' values 0-4 correspond -significant, neo, paleo, mixed, super endemesim, respectively.

title: Quantitative phylogenetic dissimilarity — ps_dissim
code: ps_dissim(ps, method = "bray", endemism = FALSE, normalize = TRUE, ...)

title: Quantitative phylogenetic dissimilarity — ps_dissim
text: ps phylospatial object. method Character indicating dissimilarity index use, passed vegdist. default "bray", .e. Bray-Curtis distance, also known quantitative Sorensen's. See vegdist complete list options. endemism Logical indicating whether community values divided column totals (taxon range sizes) derive endemism. normalize Logical indicating whether community values divided row totals (community sums). TRUE, dissimilarity based proportional community composition. happens endemism derived. ... Additional arguments passed vegdist.

title: Quantitative phylogenetic dissimilarity — ps_dissim

what: Calculate spatial phylogenetic diversity and endemism metrics — ps_diversity
title: Calculate spatial phylogenetic diversity and endemism metrics — ps_diversity
text: function calculates range metrics including phylogenetic diversity endemism, well diversity endemism terminals "clades" (terminal internal taxa tree, scaled branch length). continuous community data (probabilities abundances) provided, used calculations.

title: Calculate spatial phylogenetic diversity and endemism metrics — ps_diversity
Calculate spatial phylogenetic diversity and endemism metrics — ps_diversity
text: ps phylospatial object (created phylospatial() ps_simulate()). spatial Logical: function return spatial object (TRUE, default) vector (FALSE).

title: Calculate spatial phylogenetic diversity and endemism metrics — ps_diversity
text: matrix raster stack column layer (respectively) diversity metric.

title: Calculate spatial phylogenetic diversity and endemism metrics — ps_diversity
text: function calculates following metrics: TR: Terminal richness, .e. richness terminal taxa (many cases species) CR: Clade richness, .e. richness taxa levels (equivalent PD cladogram) PD: Phylogenetic diversity TE: Terminal endemism, .e. total endemism-weighted diversity terminal taxa (.k.. "weighted endemism") CE: Clade endemism, .e. total endemism-weighted diversity taxa levels (equivalent PE cladrogram) PE: Phylogenetic endemism, .e. endemism-weighted PD Em: Mean endemism (equivalent CE / CR) RPD: Relative phylogenetic diversity, .e. branch length mean resident (equivalent PD / CR) PEm: Mean phylogenetic endemism, .e. branch length / range size mean resident (equivalent PE / CR) RPE: Relative phylogenetic endemism, .e. mean endemism-weighted branch length (equivalent PE / CE)

title: Phylogenetic conservation prioritization — ps_prioritize
text: Create ranking conservation priorities using greedy forward stepwise optimization.

title: Phylogenetic conservation prioritization — ps_prioritize
Phylogenetic conservation prioritization — ps_prioritize
text: ps phylospatial object. protection Starting protection status. argument specified, assumed existing reserves present. Otherwise, must numeric vector SpatRaster dimensionality matching number sites ps values 0 1 representing existing level conservation effectiveness site. lambda Shape parameter taxon conservation benefit function. can real number. Positive values, default value 1, place higher priority conserving first part range given species clade, negative values (typically used) place higher priority fully protecting taxa partially protecting taxa. See function plot_lambda details. level Effectiveness level proposed new reserves (number 0 1, meaning starting protection).

title: Phylogenetic conservation prioritization — ps_prioritize
text: ranking conservation priorities, low values representing higher priorities.

Null model randomization analysis of alpha diversity metrics — ps_rand
text: ps phylospatial object. n_rand Integer giving number random communities generate. spatial Logical: function return spatial object (TRUE, default) matrix (FALSE). n_cores Integer giving number compute cores use parallel processing. ... Additional arguments passed quantize, algorithm, n_iter, n_strata, jitter, transform, priority, etc.

title: Null model randomization analysis of alpha diversity metrics — ps_rand
text: matrix row every row x, column every metric ps_diversity, values indicating proportion randomizations observed diversity metric greater randomized metric.

title: Phyologenetic regionalization — ps_regions
text: ps phylospatial object. method anything "kmeans", must contain dissim component generated ps_add_dissim. k Number spatial clusters divide region (Positive integer). method Clustering method. Options include "kmeans" methods listed hclust. endemism Logical indicating whether community values divided column totals (taxon range sizes) derive endemism. used method = "kmeans"; cases information instead supplied ps_add_dissim. normalize Logical indicating whether community values divided row totals (community sums). TRUE, dissimilarity based proportional community composition. happens endemism derived. used method = "kmeans"; cases information instead supplied ps_add_dissim.

title: Phyologenetic regionalization — ps_regions
text: raster matrix integer indicating k regions site belongs .

title: Color space ordination of spatial phylogenetic composition — ps_rgb
Color space ordination of spatial phylogenetic composition — ps_rgb
text: ps phylospatial object non-null dissim component, generated ps_add_dissim. method Ordination method, either "pca" (principal component analysis), "cmds" (classical MDS), "nmds" (nonmetric MDS, default, slower often preferred). trans function giving transformation apply dimension ordinated data. default identity function. Specifying rank generates uniform color distribution.

title: Color space ordination of spatial phylogenetic composition — ps_rgb
text: raster matrix layers columns (respectively) containing RGB color values range 0-1.

what: Stratified randomization of community matrix — quantize
title: Stratified randomization of community matrix — quantize
text: community null model method quantitative community data (e.g. abundance occurrence probability) preserves row column totals, also approximately preserves marginal distributions rows columns. randomization, data set split strata representing numerical ranges input quantities, separate binary randomization done stratum, results combined produce randomized, quantitative community matrix. See vegan::commsim() details binary quantitative null models.

title: Stratified randomization of community matrix — quantize
code: quantize(   x,   n_strata = 5,   transform = identity,   algorithm = "curveball",   jitter = 0.99,   priority = "neither",   n_iter = 10000,   ... )

title: Stratified randomization of community matrix — quantize
text: x Community matrix species rows, sites columns, nonnegative quantities cells. n_strata Integer giving number strata split data . Must 2 greater. Larger values result randomizations less mixing higher fidelity marginal distributions. transform function used transform values x assigning n_strata equal intervals. Examples include sqrt, log, rank, etc.; default identity. algorithm Null model algorithm, passed vegan::nullmodel. Testing done "curveball" algorithm, options use caution. binary methods used. jitter Number 0 1, indicating much randomly jitter location stratum boundaries. priority Either "rows", "cols", "neither", indicating whether randomization within strata prioritize maintaining marginal distributions rows columns input matrix. default, "neither", give precedence either dimension. n_iter Positive integer giving number iterations use stepwise algorithms. ... Ignored.

title: Stratified randomization of community matrix — quantize
text: randomized version x.
